page.title: 10CLAPHAMS WOOD
page.content: This is a{sloping hillside}area.Most of the land is{farmed}and it belongs to{Barnaby Side Farm.}The path which we followed was a{broad track}which in used by the farmer when he goes to the fields in his tractor.Some of the fields contain{winter sown barley which is almost ready for harvesting. Other fields have{spring sown barley which will be ready for harvest in the autumn.There was a small area of {evergreen tree.}There was a wood which was mostly{deciduous,}it was called {Claphams Wood.}We also saw a large black barn full of straw.A{dry stone {wall}ran along the edge of the wood to seperate it from the fields.Most of the fields had{wire fencing}or{hedges. Some of the fields just had grass in them.In other fields there were{pigs. The pigs were{crossbred saddleback .
